alert.note: Alert for Little River; Miller (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued October 04 at 1:03PM CDT until October 04 at 3:30PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: The National Weather Service in Shreveport has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Little River County in southwestern Arkansas... Northwestern Miller County in southwestern Arkansas... East Central Bowie County in northeastern Texas... * Until 330 PM CDT. * At 103 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 5 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Texarkana, Wake Village, Ashdown, Nash, Hooks, Redwater, Red Lick, Ogden, Richmond, Mandeville, Leary, Pine Prairie, Red Bank, Arden and Wallace. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
